text: In a hybrid warehouse automation in retail where stakeholders keep adding requests and governance requires scope control, what should the project manager do to determine and prioritize requirements?

options.label: facilitate discovery with stakeholders to capture requirements and priorities
accept every request without ranking
ignore users and rely only on sponsor opinions
delay prioritization until build starts

explanation: Option a is correct because structured discovery surfaces needs and priorities. Option b is incorrect because unprioritized scope leads to overload. Option c is incorrect because limited perspectives miss real needs. Option d is incorrect because late prioritization causes churn.

text: Given a predictive warehouse automation in insurance where dependencies to other programs exist and a demo to regulators is pending, which action best supports determine and prioritize requirements?

options.label: treat all requirements as equal to avoid conflict
rank requirements using agreed criteria such as MoSCoW or value-risk
freeze scope without validating alignment
accept every request without ranking

explanation: Option b is correct because shared criteria make prioritization transparent. Option a is incorrect because lack of priority impedes trade-offs. Option c is incorrect because unvalidated scope risks misalignment. Option d is incorrect because unprioritized scope leads to overload.

text: While facing a hybrid omnichannel launch in insurance where dependencies to other programs exist and a demo to regulators is pending, what is the most effective next step to determine and prioritize requirements?

options.label: ignore users and rely only on sponsor opinions
delay prioritization until build starts
link requirements to objectives and acceptance criteria
treat all requirements as equal to avoid conflict

explanation: Option c is correct because traceability keeps scope aligned to goals. Option a is incorrect because limited perspectives miss real needs. Option b is incorrect because late prioritization causes churn. Option d is incorrect because lack of priority impedes trade-offs.

text: For a product-led omnichannel launch in logistics where stakeholders keep adding requests and budget pressure is high, what should the project manager do first to determine and prioritize requirements?

options.label: freeze scope without validating alignment
accept every request without ranking
ignore users and rely only on sponsor opinions
engage end users to validate and refine priorities

explanation: Option d is correct because user input strengthens requirement relevance. Option a is incorrect because unvalidated scope risks misalignment. Option b is incorrect because unprioritized scope leads to overload. Option c is incorrect because limited perspectives miss real needs.
